verbs.description: tweeze (third-person singular simple present tweezes, present participle tweezing, simple past and past participle tweezed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pluck or grasp using tweezers.
examples: Stamp-men tweeze their treasures to avoid smudging, wear, tear; to hold them up to the light or pick them out of benzine baths in search of watermarks.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To shape by plucking out hairs with tweezers.
examples: Here Mrs. Lawrence had smiled to soften the anxiety of her blue eyes under their frowning, carefully tweezed brows.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To pluck out hairs using tweezers.
examples: Word to the wise: if you must tweeze solo, stick to plucking only the obvious stray hairs.
